newsitem.title: GERMANY: BASF chief bets on better results in 97.
newsitem.headline: BASF chief bets on better results in 97.

text.p: German chemicals and drug group BASF AG said on Thursday that it expected sales and profits to remain at high levels and for full year sales to top 50 billion marks and profits to be higher.
Fresh from posting a nearly four percent rise in first quarter pre-tax profits and a 13.6 percent rise in sales, BASF chairman Juergen Strube said that results would continue to be strong.
"In 1997 we will again show our shareholders that BASF has become more agile, quicker, and more profitable," Strube said in the text of a speech distributed before the annual meeting.
